author: Staff Reporter
text: The District Mahila Court in The Nilgiris on Thursday convicted a history-sheeter and sentenced him to seven years imprisonment for robbing a woman at knifepoint at Coonoor on September 28, 2010. The police said that the victim R. Amala Ranganayaki, a resident of Cornwell Road in Coonoor, was at home with her granddaughter when B. Manoj (26), of Bandishola in Springfield Post, threatened her and fled with a little more than 20 sovereigns of gold jewellery. After the trial, the Mahila Court Judge M. Sarvamangala convicted him and also slapped a fine of Rs. 10,000 on him.
title: Jail term for robbing woman
